recipe.title: How to Make Yakitori
recipe.intro: Yakitori is Japanese grilled chicken on sticks. The sauce is sweet and salty.
recipe.ingredients: chicken thigh, green onion, soy sauce, sugar, mirin, sake, bamboo sticks
steps: **Cut** the green onion into short pieces.
**Put** chicken and green onion on the bamboo sticks.
**Mix** soy sauce, sugar, mirin, and sake in a small pot and boil.
**Grill** the sticks on a hot pan for 3 minutes on each side.
**Brush** the sauce on the chicken and grill one more minute. **Enjoy!**

review.content: I went to Hilltop Lantern with my friends on Friday night. It was on a small hill in Surry Hills. We could see the city lights from the terrace. The night was cool and nice. We ordered many yakitori sticks. The chicken was juicy and the sauce was perfect. We also had cold drinks. The lanterns on the terrace were so pretty. They had warm yellow light. We talked and laughed all night. It was a very fun time.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: What are those sticks? They look interesting!

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: These are yakitori. It is Japanese grilled chicken.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Oh nice! Did you make the sauce too?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Yes! I mixed soy sauce, sugar, and mirin.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: It smells amazing. Can I try one?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Yes, please! Be careful, it is very hot.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Mmm! This is so good! The sauce is sweet.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Thank you! In Japan, we eat yakitori at small shops.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Really? I want to go to Japan someday.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: You should! Japan has many good food shops.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Can you make more yakitori? Everyone wants some!

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Of course! I am happy everyone likes it.
